arts.ttl: 'Pressure them': Eddie Howe suggests Newcastle targeted two Arsenal players in Carabao Cup win
arts.sum: Eddie Howe masterminded another brilliant win for Newcastle United over Arsenal in the Carabao Cup on Wednesday evening, overseeing another 2-0 win for his side....

arts.ttl: 'I was very happy': Bruno Guimaraes says he was delighted after what Martin Odegaard did in Arsenal vs Newcastle
Arsenal fans' response spoke volumes as Newcastle United shut down 'bullies'
arts.sum: Having struck first through Jacob Murphy, Newcastle's bold approach paid off for the Magpies' second when a supposed centre-back in Fabian Schar sprinted the length of the field to pick Declan Rice's pocket outside Arsenal's box and set up Anthony Gordon. There was an edge to Newcastle, epitomised by the returning Kieran Trippier, who at one point stood over Gabriel and got in his face after the towering Arsenal defender went down softly following a shove to the back.

arts.ttl: Newcastle United hit back at 'cheating' Arsenal as humiliating taunt heard - 5 things - Ciaran Kelly - Chronicle Live
arts.sum: Jacob Murphy opened the scoring for Newcastle in the 19th minute after Alexander Isak's shot cannoned off the upright before Anthony Gordon doubled his side's lead just after the break after the Magpies hunted the Gunners down. Here are five things we learned from the semi-final second-leg as Newcastle booked their place at Wembley following a 4-0 aggregate victory.

arts.ttl: Gary Neville delivers brutal Gabriel and William Saliba dig after Alexander Isak display
arts.sum: Arsenal defenders Gabriel and William Saliba had a torrid time up against Alexander Isak as the Gunners fell short against Newcastle in their Carabao Cup semi-final

arts.ttl: Eddie Howe reveals Newcastle only had TWO DAYS to work on the new system that downed Arsenal and sealed Carabao Cup final spot
arts.sum: Howe's side - who are in the Carabao Cup final for the second time in three years - will now play either Tottenham or Liverpool in the showpiece event on Sunday, March 16.

arts.ttl: Mikel Arteta admits Arsenal players must 'recharge' during Dubai warm-weather training - after 'painful' Carabao Cup defeat to Newcastle
arts.sum: Just days after their thrashing of Manchester City 5-1, Arteta's players will be forced to take stock after losing 4-0 on aggregate, their wait for a domestic trophy rolling on.

arts.ttl: Every word from Arteta's post-Newcastle presser
arts.sum: We didn’t generate enough situations in the final third and the game started to get away from us. Overall, that was the main difference – it’s true that today we were a bit more unsettled, especially when the game became more chaotic or when they were very direct with their play.

arts.ttl: Newcastle's path to silverware is clear, Arsenal's is not
arts.sum: Newcastle United will have a chance to end their trophy drought that has lasted nearly six decades, whereas Arsenal are still on the quest to win any silverware.

arts.ttl: Eddie Howe determined to end Newcastle’s trophy drought in Carabao Cup final
arts.sum: A dominant 2-0 win secured the Magpies a 4-0 aggregate victory over the Gunners.
